b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:47): question - it's more about using vs2005, though. i have a solution with 3 projects inside. the solution is named S. the projects are P1, P2, P3. now, shouldn't P1 be accessible just with a 'using P1;' ?

132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:47): Okay... i am actually having my first try at threading... i got a ListView and when user click an item, some data will be pulled out of the database and put into a side box, though i don't wnat this to freeze the system so i thought of a thread, but if the user clicks another row of the list view, then here i'm stuck, i thought if (MyThread != null) { MyThread.Abort(); }  then restart a new thread...
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:48): seems like VC# doesn't like the fact i'm aborting a running side thread from the main one... so does anybody got some advices they could give me ?
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:49): rajesh: 1. There isn't necessarily a direct connection between a project name and the namespaces the classes in it are in
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:49): 2. You still need to add a project reference from the project needing to access the classes
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:50): StaZ[work]: Thread.Abort() is evil
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:50): Arild okay, noted :)
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:50): But i don't want it to finish :P
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:50): find some other way to notify the thread, set a variable or something
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:50): or just let it run
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:50): and ignore the result
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:51): the result is displayed in a TreeView, i can't start another thread that will affect the same treeview, but i can try with a variable
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:52): don't let the thread manipulate the tree view, instead have the thread notify the gui when it's done
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:52): if you want to ignore the result, just unhook the notification
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:52): oh, and take a look at BackgroundWorker
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:52): Arild: so, I should be doing a 'using S.P1;' ?
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:52): no
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:53): hmm. afraid i'm not too sure of what you said earlier.
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:53): i got the 'no' part though. heh.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:53): find out what namespace the classes you want are in, then add a using for that
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (18:53): Arild well that seems to be exactly what i need, thank you very much
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:53): Arild: hmm ok.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:54): after adding a project reference
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:54): but would I have to qualify it with the solution name first - like, S.P1, or just the project name - like, P1?
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:54): solution name and project name has nothing to do with it
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:54): i'll take a look at project reference.
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:55): Arild: ok, thanks.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:55): the namespace is all that matters
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:55): it should be. didn't notice there was someting like 'project reference'.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:55): some times the namespace has some similarity with the project name, but that's really neither here nor there
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:55): using is for namespaces
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:56): so, does that mean, if i add a project reference, there is no need for a 'using ... '?
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:56): no, you need to do both
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:56): and what's the equivalent of adding an include path on vs2005?
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:57): reference to make the types available to the project at all, and using to bring the types in the namespace into scope
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:57): gotcha.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:57): there's no such thing as an include path
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:57): use a project reference
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (18:57): not a file reference
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (18:57): hmm ok. alright. cool. thanks a lot.
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (19:00): Arild: i'm also looking for some parser generators (like flex/bison) ... and i came across coco. are there any others you might recommend?
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (19:00): cos otherwise, coco it is.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:00): I have a list somewhere
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:01): rajesh: Take a look at ANTLR
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (19:01): ok, shall do.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:01): also, Mono has a port of yacc called "jay" somewhere in its source tree
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:01): it's what they use for their C# compiler
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:03): rajesh: http://www.thefreecountry.com/programming/compilerconstruction.shtml

132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:03): hey i just say this on the article i'm reading : BackgroundWorker worker = sender as BackgroundWorker;   what is the difference between this and   BackgroundWorker worker = (BackgroundWorker)sender;   ???
b803723c1734149d4a6fbc7fcaf64ff9 (19:04): Arild: cool, thanks.
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:04): as returns null if the cast doesn't succeed, (..) throws an exception
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:04): oh good to know thank you
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:05): the (..) is an explicit cast, how is the  "as ..." method called ?
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:06): just like you just posted?
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:11): well... that thing could've had a relevant name.. :P
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:12): (is relevant or revelant, i never remember)
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:12): the former
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:12): don't think revelant is a word
52d6c3d9bac87ece3683eefd396af8f2 (19:12): "revenant" is, though
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:13): okay... so it's NOT the one that look like a french word
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:13): Revenant? there are lots in games :P
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:13): there's a unit by this name in HOMM5
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:15): anyway, how would i send mode than one param to a BackgroundWordker  ->   bwFiller.RunWorkerAsync(BaseUnit);    <- i'd need another one
e930486dc1ff22e535dfd95d2b4ea972 (19:23): StaZ[home]: make something to hold both objects and pass that one object
132e476d5f149efcd8a028b22510d8c3 (19:26): bwFiller.RunWorkerAsync(new object[] {m_Dossier, m_ID_Form});    this compiles, don't know if it works yet
